content:
You're thinking of enjoying the city views from the comfort of your own hotel room! While the 23rd floor of the Marriott downtown does offer great views, it's a different experience compared to the Skydeck Chicago on the 103rd floor of the Willis Tower. Here's a brief comparison to help you decide:

**23rd floor of the Marriott:**

* You'll still get a great view of the city, but it will be from a lower altitude compared to the Skydeck Chicago.
* The view might be obstructed by other buildings or structures, depending on the direction you're facing.
* You can enjoy the view from the comfort of your own room, which is convenient if you're short on time or prefer a more relaxed experience.

**Skydeck Chicago (103rd floor of the Willis Tower):**

* The Skydeck offers breathtaking 360-degree views of the city from an incredible height of 1,353 feet (412 meters).
* You'll get a more panoramic view of the city, with the ability to see for miles in every direction.
* The Skydeck is specifically designed for observation, with floor-to-ceiling windows and an open-air Ledge that extends 4.3 feet outside the building.

If you want to experience the city lights from a unique perspective, I'd recommend visiting the Skydeck Chicago at night. The view from the 103rd floor is truly spectacular, and it's an experience you won't want to miss. However, if you're short on time or prefer a more low-key experience, the 23rd floor of the Marriott will still offer great views.

Ultimately, it's up to you to decide how you want to spend your evening. If you do decide to visit the Skydeck Chicago at night, consider purchasing a separate ticket or the "Sun & Stars" ticket option, which allows you to visit during the day and return for a nighttime visit on the same day.
